string.text: 30-round Bakelite magazine that is standard issue with the Ukrainian military. One of the most common magazines in the Zone. Designation "6L20".

60-round quad-stack magazine for the AK-74 series. Extremely rare to find in Russia as only small batches were produced, but it is rumored the Ukrainian SSU started producing their own to fit their needs of controlling the Zone. Designation "6L31".

30-round polymer magazine that is standard issue with the Russian military, shipped with the AK-74M. One of the most common magazines in the Zone. This magazine can be tweaked to accommodate different calibers. Designation "6L23".

Modern PMAG-style AK magazine holding 30 rounds. The build quality is very high and loading rounds in is quite effortless. Magazines like these are usually only found on Spetsnaz black ops units along with cutting edge Alpha AKs.
45-round Bakelite magazine that comes standard with the RPK-74 LMG. This magazine also fits into AK-74 derivatives. Designation "6L18"
Modified RPK magazine to fit 5.56 NATO rounds. Also compatible with the export AK-101 and AK-102.
30-round steel 7.62x39 magazine. Magazines like these are quite old but still function relatively well.

30-round AK-103 Magazine in 7.62x39. Modern materials and construction have made the magazine far lighter than its steel counterparts. In addition, this magazine can be modified to accommodate other calibers.
PMAG-style 7.62x39 magazine made from polymer. The build quality and design allows for fast loading of rounds. Such a piece of equipment is an unusual sight in the Zone.

Drum magazine with a belt for the RPD. The box holds 100 rounds in a belt. While the RPD was ultimately supplanted by the more accurate and flexible RPK, being able to shoot off 100 rounds is nothing to scoff at.
Steel 40-round RPK Magazine. This is also compatible with the AKM and other 7.62x39 AK rifles.
Proprietary ACE-21 Magazine that holds 35 rounds. The outdated model found in the Zone requires proprietary Galil magazines, which makes the weapon a fancy novelty more than anything else.
30-round magazine for the export AK101 and AK102. This magazine can be tweaked to fit different calibers.
Proprietary 30-round magazine for the first generation of AUG rifles. Later variants have a magwell that adapts them to use the standard STANAG pattern.
Standard semi-translucent G36 Magazine with capacity for 30 rounds of 5.56x45 ammunition.

30-round HK STANAG magazine used by a majority of NATO assault rifles, including the M4 carbine, M16, LR-300, L85 and FN F2000. It is rumored that Freedom is covertly supplied by NATO or another Western power, which explains this magazine's strange abundance in the Zone.
30-round STANAG magazine modified to feed 5.45x39 rounds. Why anyone would modify a rifle in this way is anyone's guess.
Modern PMAG-style magazine holding 30 rounds. Considerably lighter than its steel counterpart, the ergonomic design facilitates quick loading of cartridges.
Extended 40-round polymer magazine compatible with most NATO rifles.
60-round quad-stack magazine compatible with NATO rifles. Offers a lot of firepower, but is extremely heavy and the quad-stack nature makes it difficult to load in rounds quickly.
Swiss-made SG550 Magazine holding 30 rounds. Compatible with the SIG SG550, SG552 and SG550-1 Sniper.
Swiss-made SG550-1 Magazine holding 20 rounds. Used in the SG550-1 Sniper variant, but is compatible in other rifles of the same family.
Box containing a belt with capacity for 100 5.56x45 rounds.

20-round magazine for the Type 63 rifle made of stamped steel. Most Type 63s found in the Zone have the bolt hold-open device removed so they can fit more common AKM magazines. This magazine will also fit into AK-style rifles as well.
Type 63 magazine modified to fit large 7.62x54R rounds. The Type 63 is a favorite of bandit clans; conversion to the full-size rifle round is the speciality of the bandit technician Limpid.
Standard 20-round AS VAL magazine, also compatible with SR-3M and VSS rifles. Designation "6L25".
30-round 9x39 magazine that comes standard with the SR-3M "Vihr" rifle. Also compatible with the VSS and AS VAL rifles. Designation "SR3M.130"
Standard 10-round VSS Magazine, also compatible with the AS VAL and SR3M rifles. Designation "6L24".
20-round box magazine used in the 9A-91 and VSK-94 rifles.
20-round magazine of 9x39 that comes standard with the OTs-14 Groza assault rifle. Design is similar to the AK-style magazines.
Standard 10-round box magazine for the Gewehr 43.
Standard 20 round box magazine for the Israeli Galil battle rifle.
Standard STANAG-style Magazine for 7.62x51 NATO rounds. Used in the HK417, SCAR and SR-25. Holds 20 rounds.
Extended STANAG-style Magazine for 7.62x51 NATO rounds. Used in the HK417, SCAR and SR-25. Holds 30 rounds.
Modernized PMAG-style Magazine for 7.62x51 NATO rounds. Used in the HK417, SCAR and SR-25. Holds 20 rounds.
Compact 10-round STANAG-style Magazine for 7.62x51 NATO rounds. Comes by default with the KAC SR-25, but can fit in the HK417 and SCAR Mk. 17.

Standard 20-round 7.62x51 magazine used in battle rifles with hinged magazine locking mechanisms. Whatever minor differences in the compatibility between weapons and magazines of this style have been 'worked out' by Zone technicians. Used in the FN FAL, Mk. 14 EBR and G3 rifles.
Extended 30-round 7.62x51 magazine used in battle rifles with hinged magazine locking mechanisms. Used in the FN FAL, Mk. 14 EBR and G3 rifles.
Standard-issue 10-round magazine for the L96A1. The L96 is a favorite of Western mercenaries and Monolith forces.
Standard 5-round Remington 700 Magazine. The Remington 700 is a popular hunting rifle and fares rather well in the Zone's conditions.
Heavy box that holds 100 rounds of 7.62x54R ammunition in a belt, for use with the PKM. It is advised to bring a few of these if you plan on hunting Pseudogiants or Chimeras.

Standard 10-round polymer magazine for the SV-98 sniper rifle. The SV-98 is used primarily by Russian law enforcement; limited numbers have found their way into the hands of the Duty faction through secret channels.
Standard 10-round magazine for the SVD and SVU sniper rifle. The SVD is popular with members of all factions, if they can get their hands on such a rifle.
Extended 20-round magazine for the SVD and SVU sniper rifle. Commonly used with the SVU-A rifle to allow it to temporarily fill the role of LMG in close quarters engagements.
Standard 10-round magazine used with the SVT-40 rifle. The SVT-40 is a classic Great War rifle that is popular with many stalkers, especially Loners.

Standard 10-round magazine used with the SVT-40 rifle. The SVT-40 is a classic Great War rifle that is popular with many stalkers, especially Loners. This variant has been modified slightly to allow for loading of 7.62x54 machine gun rounds.
SVT-40 magazine modified to load the intermediate 7.62x39 round.

5-round magazine for the Sako TRG-42, L96 AWM and M24 SWS. This magazine was originally designed for the Sako, however, it has been 'modified' slightly to accommodate different rifles. Works fine in most rifles, as long as you remember to tap the magazine every once in a while.
Standard-issue 10-round magazine for the L96A1 that fits the slightly larger and considerably more powerful .338 Lapua Magnum. The L96 is a favorite of Western mercenaries and Monolith forces.
10-round magazine compatible with the Barrett M98B.
Standard 5-round magazine used in the VSSK sniper rifle.
Standard ASh-12 Magazine with capacity for 10 rounds. It is unlikely more than 10 rounds will ever be needed for human targets.
Extended ASh-12 Magazine with capacity for 20 rounds. For when you need to bring down giant mutants.

10-round magazine for the Barrett M82 rifle, modified to fit 12.7x55 STs rounds. The first stalker to bring such a monster of a weapon discarded it after running out of ammunition; enterprising technicians have retrofitted this weapon to fire more common rounds without needing to replace the very heavy barrel.
Standard Saiga-12S magazine with capacity for 8 shotshells. The Saiga is a good quality shotgun that is popular with Dutyers.
Extended Saiga-12S magazine with capacity for 12 shotshells. More shells means more mutants you can kill each each magazine.
20-shell drum for the USAS-12 automatic shotgun. The firepower offered by the USAS-12 is unrivaled at short range, although the weight and magazine bulk makes it impractical to carry around.
Standard 10-shell magazine for the Vepr-12. Despite their similarities, the Vepr cannot share magazines with the Saiga.
A small magazine for the Vepr-12 with only five shell capacity. Don't be fooled - the magazine can fit in your pocket and is extremely easy to load.
